channel.title: math.OA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.OA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Exotic groupoid $C^*$-algebras associated to double groupoids
item.description: arXiv:2404.11297v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We consider a class of local action groupoids called double groupoids which are constructed from pairs of subgroups satisfying similar conditions to those of a matched pair of groups. They are partial transformation groupoids whenever they are \'etale, and in this setting, we show that if the partially acting group admit exotic ideal completions in the sense of Brown and Guentner, then the corresponding double groupoid also admit exotic $C^*$-completions.
item.dc:creator: Mathias Palmstr{\o}m

item.title: Towards a classification of unitary elements of C*-algebras
item.description: arXiv:2304.01761v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In [6] the author conjectures and partially shows that the Cuntz semigroup classifies unitary elements of unital AF-algebras. We provide a complete proof by addressing the existence part of the conjecture, under a mild adjustment of both domain and codomain of the functor Cu. We also tackle the classification beyond the AF case and more particularly, we look at unitary elements of what we call AH$_1$-algebras. We obtain positive progress as far as the existence part is concern. Nevertheless, we reveal some crucial information needed for the uniqueness part of the classification that the Cuntz semigroup fails to capture.
item.dc:creator: Laurent Cantier

item.title: On an inequality of Lin, Kim and Hsieh and Strong Subadditivity
item.description: arXiv:2402.15920v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We give an elementary proof of an inequality of Lin, Kim and Hsieh that implies strong subadditivity of the non Neumann entropy.
item.dc:creator: Eric A. Carlen, Michael P. Loss

item.title: Paired and Toeplitz + Hankel operators
item.description: arXiv:2404.05435v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We present complete classifications of paired operators on the Hilbert space $L^2(\mathbb{T})$ and Toeplitz + Hankel operators on vector-valued Hardy spaces. We introduce the notion of inner-paired operators defined on the Hardy space that use the classical model spaces. We fully classify inner-paired operators.
item.dc:creator: Nilanjan Das, Soma Das, Jaydeb Sarkar
